conclusion: Determine when the two waves meet by calculating the time it takes for each wave to travel from its source to the meeting point.
Identify the sources and their distances to the meeting point: Source 1 at x = -0.2 m and Source 2 at x = 1.2 m.
Denote the meeting point as x = d.
Calculate the distance traveled by the wave from x = -0.2 m to x = d: d1 = |d + 0.2|.
Calculate the distance traveled by the wave from x = 1.2 m to x = d: d2 = |d - 1.2|.
The speed of each wave is v = 0.4 m/s.
Determine the time taken by the wave from x = -0.2 m: t1 = |d + 0.2| / 0.4.
Determine the time taken by the wave from x = 1.2 m: t2 = |d - 1.2| / 0.4.
Set up the equation for the meeting point: |d + 0.2| = |d - 1.2|.
Solve the absolute value equation: Case 1: d + 0.2 = d - 1.2, which simplifies to 0.2 = -1.2 (not possible).
Solve the absolute value equation: Case 2: d + 0.2 = -(d - 1.2), which simplifies to 2d = 1, thus d = 0.5.
Verify the solution: If d = 0.5 m, both distances traveled by the waves are 0.7 m, confirming they meet at x = 0.5 m.
Calculate the time taken for the waves to reach the meeting point: t = 0.7 / 0.4 = 1.75 s.
The two waves meet at t = 1.75 s.
